bestBHT.bht: The people were confounded and impressed by Jesus' prudence and wisdom in His unexpected and cautious answer. Their attempts to bring Him into contempt were futile, leaving them silenced, confounded, and disappointed. This exemplifies how God turns the wicked attempts of His enemies into victories, triumphing over them and displaying His glory.

John Calvin: Here, too, it appears how God turns to a different purpose the wicked attempts of His enemies, and not only disappoints their expectation, but even drives them back with disgrace.
However numerous may be their assaults on the Word of God, there is an equal number of victories which God has in his hand, to triumph over them and Satan their head.
Christ intended to give a peculiar display of his glory, by compelling those men to depart crowned with shame.
Philip Schaff: Matthew 22:22. They marvelled. Probably both confounded and impressed.
John Gill: They marvelled: were amazed and astonished, at his prudence and wisdom, in answering them, in such an unexpected and cautious manner.
They left him: being silenced, confounded, and disappointed.

And went their way: not being able to get any advantage against him, neither to bring him into contempt with the people, and alienate their affections from him; nor to charge him with sedition or treason to the Roman governor; and so had but a very indifferent account of their success, to report to them that sent them.

bhtAttempts.bht: In Matthew 22:22, the people were left both confounded and impressed by Jesus' answer, as their attempt to trap Him in His words had backfired. They marveled at His prudence and wisdom, while being silenced, confounded, and disappointed. Even though they had tried to bring Him into contempt with the people, they were not able to gain any advantage against Him. This passage showcases how God uses the wicked attempts of His enemies to drive them back with disgrace and displays the victories that He holds in His hand.

The people were both confounded and impressed by Jesus' reply, marveling at His prudence and wisdom. Their attempts to trap Him in His words backfired, leaving them silenced, confounded, and disappointed. Despite their efforts to bring Him into contempt with the people, they failed to gain any advantage against Him. This highlights how God uses the wicked attempts of His enemies to drive them back with disgrace and showcases the victories He holds in His hand.

The people were left confounded and impressed by Jesus' reply, marveling at His prudence and wisdom. Their attempts to trap Him in His words backfired, leaving them silenced, confounded, and disappointed. Despite their efforts to bring Him into contempt, they failed to gain any advantage against Him. This shows how God uses the wicked attempts of His enemies to drive them back with disgrace and highlights His victorious power.

The people marveled at Jesus' prudence and wisdom in His unexpected and cautious answer. Their attempts to bring Him into contempt with the people were to no avail, as they were left silenced, confounded, and disappointed. This showcases how God turns the wicked attempts of His enemies into victories, triumphing over them and demonstrating His glory.

The people were confounded and impressed by Jesus' prudence and wisdom in His unexpected and cautious answer. Their attempts to bring Him into contempt were futile, leaving them silenced, confounded, and disappointed. This exemplifies how God turns the wicked attempts of His enemies into victories, triumphing over them and displaying His glory.
